org.workplicity.worklet
Class WorkletContext

java.lang.Object
  org.workplicity.worklet.WorkletContext

public class WorkletContext
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides several helper functions for a worklet. This class is constructed only by other worklet contexts through the launch method. Thus, it cannot and should not be constructed directly, not through its constructor nor through getInstance.

Method Detail

getInstance

public static WorkletContext getInstance()
Singleton to get the worklet context

Returns:
the "boot" worklet context

publish

public void publish(java.lang.String tag,
                    Entry entry)
Publishes a copy of an entry into the IWC under a given tag. Since the entry is copied into the IWC, modifying the original reference does not affect the copy. Also, since the entry is serialized, every object it contains must also be serializable.

Any threads waiting on the tag are awakened when the entry is published.

Parameters:
tag - Tag
entry - Entry

read

public Entry read(java.lang.String tag)
Reads an entry without removing it from the IWC and without waiting.

Parameters:
tag - Tag
Returns:
Entry if found, null otherwise

read

public Entry read(java.lang.String tag,
                  long expiry)
Reads an entry without removing it from the IWC. The read blocks for approximately the expiration time. We say "approximately" because the exact time depends on the number of other threads waiting for an IWC tag, not necessarily this one.

Parameters:
tag - Tag
expiry - Expiration time.
Returns:
Entry if found, null if timeout occurs.

take

public Entry take(java.lang.String tag)
Takes and removes an entry from the IWC without waiting.

Parameters:
tag - Tag
Returns:
Entry if found, null otherwise

take

public Entry take(java.lang.String tag,
                  long expiry)
Takes and removes an entry from the IWC and waiting for it if necessary.

Parameters:

Returns:
Etnry
